==What a Deal Outline Looks Like== */Deal/ **Pcpl=[[User:JH]] ***Sign.Time=March 2, 2013 **Cttr=[[User:MarcD]] ***Sign.Time=March 3, 2013 **Agt.Date.Effective=May 1, 2012 **Acceptance.Lapse.Period=thirty (30) days */Choice/ **Dispute=[[Org_Mozilla_Consult_Agt_Dispute_Arb_Library]] ***Forum=[[Ct_UStCA_SantaClara]] ***Cost=[[Dispute_Cost_Mutual]] */Form/ **/Text/=[[Org_Mozilla_Consult_Agt_Library]] **/Outline/=[[Org_Mozilla_Consult_Agt_Outline]] **/Frame/=[[Model_Agt_Frame]] ==Outline with Web-Scraping and Abbreviations== The co-founder, Edwards, is assured that he has the same deal as the founder, except as specified. GUID: 12345 AKA = Acme_StockOption_Grant_02 /DealPoints/ [Optionee.*] = [User:Edwards,_Edward_S] Option.Expiration.Date = January 31, 2017 Option.Quantity = Two Hundred Thousand (200,000) Option.Vest.Cliff.% = six percent (6%) /Base/ [*] = [Acme_StockOption_Grant_01] Making up a lending situation. GUID: 12346 #AKA = 1stNat_Acme_2013-01_FixedRate #/DealPoints/ ##Agt.Date = March 14, 2013 ##Principal.Amount.$ = $6,000,000 ##RepWar.Brwr.Environ.Except._Sec=Environmental. {Brwr.-} has been informed by the California Attorney General of an inquiry regarding an underground tank at {Brwr.Irvine.Addr.1,2}. #/Parties/ ##[Lndr.*] = [User:1stNational_Mortgage] ##[Brwr.*] = [User:Acme_Inc] #/Fit/ ##[*] = [Commercial_Fixed_Rate] ##[Lndr.Branch.*] = [1stNat_Branch_LosAngeles] ##[*] = [SecuredBy_RE_Manufacturing] ##[*] = [Law_UStCA] ##[Dispute.*] = [{h:CmA}Commercial_Arb_And_Mediation] #/Form/ ##[*] = [http:ilta.org/cma/Commercial_Loan_REV-2013-01-15] #/Meta/ ##h:CmA=http://beta.commonaccord.org/wiki/ Note: Abbreviations can be done in the List using the {Token} format. Abbreviations between "[" and "]" are evaluated before any others. ==Expanding a List is like Rendering== Expanding an Outline into a NameSpace is fundamentally similar to the method of rendering a document. What follows in this page is: * Outline we will expand into a NameSpace * A mockup using the existing MW plug for Fields to show how this expands. (Push render!) * Some infrastructure fudge to make the mockup work right. (Ignore!) Note that once all the replacements have been made at the List level (there are no "{"s on the left side), then use this rendering as our Field list to render the document. Two passes, one at the List level, the next to render the doc. Similar to code as data. Or, to put it another way, a single mental map works at both levels, so fluency at either level is good for both. Note that for this demo, the "{}" means "[]" and vice-versa. ==CmA Lists are Outlines== We want to write as outlines *List1 AKA=ID_001 **Def._Sec="Simple" means good. **/Form/={List2} **Deal._Sec=We will do the right thing. **/Envir/={OurDocEnvironment} *List2 AKA=ID_002 **Doc.Body=Title
  1. [Agt._Sec.S]
**Agt._Sec.S=
  1. [Def._Sec]
  2. [Deal._Sec]
**/text/={OurForm_Emp} *OurDocEnvironment AKA=ID_003 **{OurForm_Emp}={ID_23432} Meta:ListsOfLists_Experiment List1=Def._Sec="Simple" means good.
/Form/={List2}
Deal._Sec=We will do the right thing.
/Envir/={OurDocEnvironment_Index} Supporting Lists=- List2=Doc.Body=Title
  1. [Agt._Sec.S]

Agt._Sec.S=
  1. [Def._Sec]
  2. [Deal._Sec]

/Text/={OurForm_Emp} OurDocEnvironment_Index=treat the following as if they were listings in a list called OurDocEnvironment_Index OurForm_Emp={ID_23432} Kludge to get the above working. I use a number of tricks here. Focus should be on the above. This is the third list. Doc.Body=The expanded List1:
{List1} ID_23432=[[Model_Employ_Agt_Outline]] ==CmA makes CmA== There are two main arguments for a code-as-data approach: # It is consistent. If you can understand how to make a doc, you know how to make a tree of docs, portfolio or working environment. # It can be easily distributed, shared, reimplemented, etc. Here's how to make CmA make CmA (dixit Lun): The MW app can be understood as: A bunch of: *GUID=StringOfText A default GUID defines the URL paths: *G:1 **MyForm=[[G:004]] **MyDoc=[[G:003]] **Main_Page=[[G:002]] *G:002 **V:03=[[G:007]] (T=13-03-04:0638) **V:02=[[G:006]] (T=13-03-04:0600) **V:01=[[G:005]] (T=13-03-04:0500) *G:003 **V:03=[[G:010]] (T=13-03-04:0703) **V:02=[[G:009]] (T=13-03-04:0702) **V:01=[[G:008]] (T=13-03-04:0701) etc... *G:005=First try at Main_Page!! *G:006=Second try at Main_Page!! *G:007=Third try at Main_Page!!! *G:008=First try at MyDoc!! *G:009=Second try at MyDoc!! *G:010=Third try at MyDoc!!! etc. ===API to a GUID=== MW can be understood to have (for each URL) an API that is: *Read (gives text with markup expanded) *Edit (raw text) *Save (write to a new GUID, top-off the URL-Index of the URL with the new GUID *History (give URL-Index with some info expanded) CmA adds: * Render -- like Read but with {Tokens} expanded. One could add a new command: * Top-Off -- Add at the top of the fields list some new entries. In the Outline form described above, this would be: */Write.003/ /T=13-03-04:0701)/ **Pcpl.Sign.Date=March 4, 2013 **Cttr.Sign.Date=March 3, 2013 Query to all -- would this be adequate to do the whole thing? [[Category:Meta]]

A "triple" is a list of words that have roughly the same role, like [[3.agents.or]] ({{:3.agents.or}}). A lawyer is said to be a person who likes to speak in threes.
The convention is "3." followed by the word that might stand in for the whole list, then the connector, ".or" or ".and". This is obviously a relatively fastidious way of handling lists, and can be automated in more elegant ways. That is an expression of the principle that a {token name} can be fulfilled by a program. Conf.Except.Intro._Cl=The term “Confidential Information” does not include any information that {RP.the} can demonstrate Conf.Except.Public._cl=is or becomes publicly available (other than as a result of a breach of this Agreement by {RP.orReps}) Conf.Except.Finds._cl=is or becomes available to {RP.a} without confidentiality restriction from a source other than {DP.a} Conf.Except.Has._cl=is known by {RP.a} prior to its disclosure by {DP.a} Conf.Except.Makes._cl=is independently developed by {RP.the} without use of or reference to {DP.the}'s Confidential Information Conf.Except.Release._cl={DP.the} discloses to third parties without obligation of confidentiality Conf.Except.Authorize._cl={DP.the} expressly authorizes {RP.the} to use or disclose Conf.Except.Compelled._Sec=Mandatory Disclosures. {Conf.Except.Compelled.Base._Sen} {Conf.Except.Compelled.Limit._Sen} {Conf.Except.Add._Sen} Conf.Except.Compelled.Base._Sen=This Agreement shall not be construed to prohibit disclosure of, and {RP.the} may disclose, the Confidential Information or any portion thereof to the extent required (i) by applicable law or regulation or (ii) (a) by a subpoena, civil investigative demand or similar demand or request of any court, regulatory authority, arbitrator{q} or tribunal, or (b) for evidentiary purposes in any relevant action, proceeding or arbitration to which {RP.andAmbit} is a party. Conf.Except.Compelled.Limit._Sen=In the case of any disclosure pursuant to this section on mandatory disclosures, the Receiving Party will give {DP.the} prior notice of the information to be disclosed to the extent that such notice is permissible and practicable under the circumstances and, upon the request and at the expense of {DP.the}, will seek to obtain confidential treatment of such information by the persons to whom it is disclosed. Govt Demand=Consider whether this provision is needed or not (bz redundant w/ Compelled.Base._Sen). Conf.Except.Add._Sen=Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Receiving Party will be permitted to disclose, with such prior notice as is reasonable under the circumstances), the Confidential Information or any portion thereof upon the request of any government or regulatory or self‑regulatory body having or claiming authority to regulate or oversee any aspect of its business or that of its affiliates, but agrees to advise them of the confidential nature of such information and request confidential treatment of such information. Conf.Except.Residual._Sec=Residual Knowledge. This Agreement is not intended to prevent {RP.the} from using Residual Knowledge, subject to any valid patents, copyrights{q} and semiconductor mask work rights of {DP.the}.

[[Agt.Misc.Delay._Sec|Delay]]. A failure or delay by any party in exercising any {{:3.power.or}} under this Agreement will not operate as a waiver of such {{:3.power.or}}, and no single or partial exercise of any such {{:3.power.or}} will preclude any other or further exercise of such {{:3.power.or}} or the exercise of any other {{:3.power.or}}. To the maximum extent permitted by applicable law:
  1. no claim or right arising out of this Agreement can be waived by a party, in whole or in part, unless such waiver is made in a writing signed by such party;
  2. a waiver given by a party will only be applicable to the specific instance for which it is given; and
  3. no notice to or demand on a party will:
    1. waive or otherwise affect any obligation of that party, or
    2. affect the right of the party giving such notice or demand to take further action without notice or demand as provided in this Agreement.
[[Category:Core.Agt]]

A very first cut. * Please focus on the names and order. Like everything else, they can be forked. But it would be really helpful to have good names from the start. * I suggest that definitions should move to the back. (Part of the principle of increasing banality.) In the front, there should be parameters - deal points like patent description, price, time, quantity, special conditions. They can be in a section or even in the prologue. * The Frame is populated with an outline from the NIH model docs here. It is populated with text at [[NIH_Patent_License_Agt_Frame]]. The Misc provisions are from the Core and need to be reviewed and dove-tailed with the NIH provisions.

Dispute Resolution. Each party:
  1. hereby irrevocably and unconditionally submits to {Dispute.Forum._cl} as the exclusive forum for the purpose of any {{:3.suit.or}} arising out of or based upon this Agreement;
  2. agrees not to commence any {{:3.suit.or}} arising out of or based upon this Agreement except in such forum; and
  3. hereby waives, and agrees not to assert, by way of motion, as a defense or otherwise, in any such {{:3.suit.or}}, any claim that:
    1. it is not subject personally to the jurisdiction of such forum;
    2. that its property is exempt or immune from attachment or execution;
    3. that the {{:3.suit.or}} in such forum is brought in an inconvenient forum;
    4. that the venue of the {{:3.suit.or}} is improper or that this Agreement or the subject matter hereof and thereof may not be enforced in or by such forum.

[[Agt.Remedy.AttyFee._Sec|Attorneys’ Fees]] In any {{:3.suit.or}} (including arbitration) to enforce or interpret the terms of this Agreement, the prevailing party shall be entitled to reasonable attorneys' fees, costs{q} and necessary disbursements in addition to any other relief to which such party may be entitled. [[Category:Core.Agt]]

<u>Term</u>. The term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and terminate on the earliest of {Agt.Term.Stop.List}. {RP.A}’s obligations with respect to use and non-disclosure of {DP.the}’s Confidential Information shall survive after termination until {Agt.Term.Conf.Protect.Period}. [[Category:Core.Agt]]

<u>[[Agt.Misc.Assign._Sec|Assignment]]</u>.  This Agreement may not be assigned by any party without the prior written consent of each other party. A party will not delegate any of its duties except with the prior written consent of the other parties. If a party does delegate a duty, whether or not permitted hereunder, the party will supervise and remain responsible for the performance of the duty by the delegee. [[Category:Core.Agt]]

1. [[Agt.Conf.Engage._Sec]]
  2. [[Agt.Def.Confidential_Information]]
  3. [[Agt.Def.Confidential_Subject_Matter]]

  5. [[Agt.Conf.Except._Sec]]

  11. [[NDA.Agt.Remedy._Sec]]
  12. [[Agt.Misc._Sec]]
  13. [[NDA.Agt.Def;Usage._Sec]]
[[Category:Core.Agt]]

[[NDA.Agt.Term._Sec|Term and Termination]]. 
  1. [[Agt.Term.Agreed.EndFixedDate._Sec]]
  2. [[Agt.Conf.Engage.Term._Sec]]
  3. [[NDA.Agt.Term.Stop._Sec]]
  4. [[NDA.Agt.Term.After._Sec]]
[[Category:Core.Agt]]

Resolution of Disputes.
  1. {Agt.Dispute.Law._Sec}
  2. [[Agt.Dispute.Negotiate._Sec]]
  3. [[Agt.Dispute.Forum._Sec]]
  4. [[Agt.Dispute.JuryWaiver._Sec]]
[[Category:Core.Agt]]

[[NDA.Agt.Remedy._Sec|Remedies]]. 
  1. [[Agt.Remedy.Cumulative._Sec]]
  2. [[NDA.Agt.Remedy.Injunct._Sec]]
  3. [[Agt.Remedy.AttyFee._Sec]]
  4. [[Agt.Remedy.ConfReturn._Sec]]
[[Category:Core.Agt]]

[[NDA.Agt.Remedy.Injunct._Sec|Injunctions]].  The Receiving Party acknowledges and agrees that:
  1. the restrictions contained in this Agreement are necessary for the protection of the business and goodwill of the Disclosing Party and the Receiving Party considers such restrictions to be reasonable for such purpose;
  2. the misappropriation or unauthorized disclosure of Confidential Information is likely to cause substantial and irreparable damage to the Disclosing Party and the other applicable Disclosing Parties; and
  3. damages may not be an adequate remedy for breach of this Agreement by the Receiving Party.
The Disclosing Party shall be entitled to injunctive or other equitable relief, in addition to all other remedies available to any of the Disclosing Parties at law or at equity, and no proof of special damages shall be necessary for the enforcement of this Agreement. [[Category:Core.Agt]]

1. [[Agt.Def.Agent]]
  2. [[Agt.Def.Confidential_Information]]
  3. [[Agt.Def.Confidentiality_Engagement]]
  4. [[Agt.Def.Contemplated_Transaction]]
  5. [[Agt.Def.Disclosing_Party]]
  6. [[Agt.Def.Purpose]]
  7. [[Agt.Def.Receiving_Party]]
  8. [[Agt.Def.Representative]]
[[Category:Core.Agt]]

<u>[[Agt.Misc.FinderFee._Sec|No Finder's Fees]]</u>.  Each party represents that it is not and will not in the future become obligated for any finder's fee or commission in connection with this Agreement or the {Contemplated Transactions}. Each party agrees to indemnify and to hold harmless other parties from any liability for any commission or compensation in the nature of a finder's or broker's fee arising out of this transaction (and the costs and expenses of defending against such liability or asserted liability) for which such party or any of its officers, employees{q} or representatives is responsible. [[Category:Core.Agt]]

[[Agt.Misc.Further._Sec|Further Assurances]].  Each party will:
  1. execute and deliver to each other party such other documents; and
  2. do such other acts and things,
as another party may reasonably request for the purpose of carrying out the intent of this Agreement. [[Category:Core.Agt]]

<u>[[Agt.Misc.Heading._Sec|Headings]]</u>.  The headings and titles of this Agreement are merely indicative and will not be interpreted to limit the meaning of the provisions of this Agreement. [[Category:Core.Agt]]
<u>[[Agt.Misc.Language._Sec|Language]]</u>.  The language of this Agreement is English. Any translation in another language is for convenience and has no legal significance. [[Category:Core.Agt]]

[[Agt.Misc.Majeure._Sec|Force Majeure]].  A party will not be liable for any delay or failure to perform its obligations under this Agreement caused by an event which:
  1. is beyond the party's reasonable control;
  2. was not reasonably foreseeable at the time of signing this Agreement; and
  3. is in the nature of a strike, riot, war, fire, act of God{q} or act of government.
[[Category:Core.Agt]]
<u>[[Agt.Misc.Notice._Sec|Notices]]</u>.  [[Agt.Misc.Notice.Base._Sen]] [[Agt.Misc.Notice.Addr._Sen]] [[Category:Core.Agt]]

<u>[[Agt.Misc.Sever._Sec|Severability]]</u>.  To the extent possible, each provision of this Agreement will be interpreted to be effective and valid under applicable law. If any provision of this Agreement is deemed prohibited or invalid under applicable law, such provision will be ineffective only to the extent of such prohibition or invalidity. Such prohibition or invalidity shall not invalidate the remainder of such provision or other provisions of this Agreement. [[Category:Core.Agt]]

<u>[[Agt.Misc.Valid._Sec|Valid and Enforceable]]</u>.  Each party represents that upon the execution and delivery of a counterpart of this Agreement by each party hereto, this Agreement will constitute the legal, valid{q} and binding obligation of such party, enforceable against such party in accordance with the terms of this Agreement. Each party represents that it has the absolute and unrestricted right, power, authority{q} and capacity to perform its obligations under this Agreement. Each person signing this Agreement on behalf of a party represents that he/she has the right, power, authority{q} and capacity to execute and deliver this Agreement on behalf of such party. [[Category:Core.Agt]]
<u>[[Agt.Misc.Amend._Sec|Amendments]]</u>.  The terms and provisions of this Agreement may be modified or amended only with the unanimous written consent of the parties. [[Category:Core.Agt]]
{{:Agt.Misc.Amend._Sec}}

<u>[[Agt.Misc.Entire._Sec|Entire Agreement]]</u>.  This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement with respect to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all other prior agreements, commitments{q} and understandings, whether written or not, among the parties or between any of them. No boilerplate provisions of any purchase order, acknowledgement{q} or other business form that a party may use in connection with the transactions contemplated by this Agreement will modify the rights, duties{q} or obligations of the parties under this Agreement, regardless of any failure of a party to object to such terms, provisions{q} or conditions. [[Category:Core.Agt]]
{{:Agt.Misc.Entire._Sec}}

<u>[[Agt.Misc.Expense._Sec|Expenses]]</u>.  Except as otherwise provided in this Agreement, each party will bear its respective costs, fees{q} and expenses incurred in connection with the preparation, negotiation, execution{q} and performance of this Agreement and the consummation and performance of the {Contemplated Transactions}, including all fees and expenses of its {Representative}s.[[Category:Core.Agt]]

1. {Term._Sec}
  2. {Disclaim._Sec}
  3. {Dispute._Sec}
  4. {Remedy._Sec}
  5. [[Agt.Misc._Sec]]
[[Category:Core.Agt]]

<u>[[Agt.Conf.CC._Sec|Circulation of Information by {RP}]]</u>. The Receiving Party may circulate Confidential Information to {Conf.CC.Who._cl}. To "circulate" information to a person means to enable a person to learn or have access to the information. [[Category:Core.Agt]]

<u>[[Agt.Conf.Engage.Term.Indefinite._Sec|Period of Confidentiality]]</u>. The Confidentiality Engagement will continue in effect until all of the Confidential Information has become subject to a Confidentiality Exception. [[Category:Core.Agt]]

<u>[[Agt.Conf.Engage.Term.FixedDate._Sec|Period of Confidentiality]]</u>. The Confidentiality Engagement will continue in effect until all of the Confidential Information has become subject to a Confidentiality Exception or {Agt.Conf.Engage.End.YMD}, whichever is first. [[Category:Core.Agt]]

<u>[[Agt.Conf.Except.Compelled._Sec|Compelled Disclosure]]</u>. If a Receiving Party becomes compelled in any Proceeding to make any disclosure that is prohibited by the Confidentiality Engagement, the Receiving Party will, to the extent legally permissible, provide the Disclosing Party with prompt notice of such compulsion so that the Disclosing Party may seek an appropriate protective order or other appropriate remedy or waive compliance with the Confidentiality Engagement. In the absence of a protective order or other remedy, the Receiving Party may disclose that portion (and only that portion) of the Confidential Information that, based upon the opinion of its counsel, the Receiving Party is legally compelled to disclose; provided, however, that the Disclosing Party uses its best efforts to obtain written assurance that any person to whom any Confidential Information is so disclosed shall accord confidential treatment to such Confidential Information. [[Category:Core.Agt]]

In the course of their discussions, the parties anticipate that each of them will reveal Confidential Information. For purposes of this Agreement, each party is a Disclosing Party with respect to its information and a Receiving Party with respect to information of the other party. [[Category:Core.Agt]]

[[Agt.Misc._Sec|Miscellaneous]].
  1. [[Agt.Misc.3Party._Sec]]
  2. [[Agt.Misc.Amend._Sec]]
  3. [[Agt.Misc.Assign._Sec]]
  4. [[Agt.Misc.Bind._Sec]]
  5. [[Agt.Misc.Comply._Sec]]
  6. [[Agt.Misc.Counterpart._Sec]]
  7. [[Agt.Misc.Delay._Sec]]
  8. [[Agt.Misc.Drafter._Sec]]
  9. [[Agt.Misc.Entire._Sec]]

  11. [[Agt.Misc.FinderFee._Sec]]
  12. [[Agt.Misc.Further._Sec]]

  14. [[Agt.Misc.Independent._Sec]]
  15. [[Agt.Misc.Language._Sec]]
  16. [[Agt.Misc.Majeure._Sec]]
  17. [[Agt.Misc.Notice._Sec]]
  18. [[Agt.Misc.Sever._Sec]]
  19. [[Agt.Misc.Successor._Sec]]
  20. [[Agt.Misc.Time._Sec]]
  21. [[Agt.Misc.Valid._Sec]]
[[Category:Core.Agt]]
<u>[[Agt.Misc.Comply._Sec|Compliance with Laws]]</u>. # [[Agt.Misc.Comply.General._Sec]] # [[Agt.Misc.Comply.ExportLaw._Sec]] [[Category:Core.Agt]]

<u>[[Agt.Misc.Comply.General._Sec|Compliance with General Laws]]</u>. Each party will comply with all governmental laws, regulations{q} and requirements applicable to them or to their performance of this Agreement. [[Category:Core.Agt]]

<u>[[Agt.Misc.Comply.ExportLaw._Sec|Compliance with Export Laws]]</u>. Each party will: # comply with all applicable export and import laws and regulations, including associated embargo and sanction regulations, and # unless authorized by applicable governmental license or regulation, not directly or indirectly export or re-export any technical information or software subject to this Agreement (including direct products of such technical information or software) to any prohibited destination or country (including release to nationals, wherever they may be located, of any prohibited country) as specified in such applicable export regulations. [[Category:Core.Agt]]

<u>[[Model_NVCA.Agt.Misc.Counterpart._Sec|Counterparts]]</u>. This Agreement may be executed in two or more counterparts, each of which will be deemed an original, but all of which together will constitute one and the same instrument. Counterparts may be delivered via electronic signature, facsimile, electronic mail (including pdf) or other transmission method and any counterpart so delivered will be deemed to have been duly and validly delivered and be valid and effective for all purposes. [[Category:Core.Agt]]

<u>[[Agt.Misc.Drafter._Sec|Cooperative Drafting and Review]]</u>. No party will be considered the drafter of this Agreement and no presumption or rule that an ambiguity will be construed against the party drafting the clause will apply to the interpretation or enforcement of this Agreement. This Agreement will be deemed to have been drafted through a cooperative effort of the parties. Each party has had an opportunity to have the Agreement reviewed and revised by their legal counsel. [[Category:Core.Agt]]
<u>[[Org_ABA/MSPA.V2.Agt.Misc.Time._Sec|Time of the Essence]]</u>. With regard to all dates and time periods set forth or referred to in this Agreement, time is of the essence. [[Category:Core.Agt]]

revision.text:
In this version, when viewing a rendered text, is it hard to figure out the name of the source field. (Contrast the XW implementation.)
A workaround is to have all of the source texts appear in the page you are working on. To do this, copy the pages from the binder, paste them at the bottom of the page and surround them with "{ { :" and "} }" (w/o the spaces), as below:
<binder> Relationship_Acme_Quake </binder>
{{:Relationship_Acme_Quake}}

[[Agt.Conf.Engage._Sec|Confidentiality Engagement]].  The "Confidentiality Engagement" means the duties of the Receiving Party expressed in this Section, understood in the context of the other provisions of this Agreement.
  1. [[Agt.Conf.Engage.Preserve._Sec]]
  2. [[Agt.Conf.Engage.Use._Sec]]
  3. [[Agt.Conf.Engage.Care._Sec]]
[[Category:Core.Agt]]
<u>[[Agt.Conf.Engage.Preserve._Sec|Preserve Confidentiality]]</u>.  The Receiving Party will preserve the confidentiality of the Confidential Information. [[Category:Core.Agt]]
<u>[[Agt.Conf.Engage.Use._Sec|Use of Confidential Information]]</u>.  The Receiving Party will use the Confidential Information only for the Purpose. [[Category:Core.Agt]]

<u>[[Agt.Conf.Engage.Care._Sec|Care]]</u>.  The Receiving Party represents that it has in place and will maintain Protective Measures throughout the Period of Confidentiality to preserve the confidentiality of Confidential Information and to prevent unauthorized use of Confidential Information. [[Category:Core.Agt]]

"[[Agt.Def.Confidential_Subject_Matter|{Confidential Subject Matter}]]" means information held or controlled by the Disclosing Party which concern:
  1. {Def.Conf.Subject._List}
[[Category:Core.Agt]]

[[Agt.Conf.Reveal._Sec|Agreed Methods for Revealing Information]]. [[Agt.Conf.Reveal.Intro._Cl]]:
  1. [[Agt.Conf.Reveal.Critical._cl]];
  2. [[Agt.Conf.Reveal.Record.Marked._cl]];
  3. [[Agt.Conf.Reveal.Mention._cl]];
  4. [[Agt.Conf.Reveal.Meeting._cl]];
  5. [[Agt.Conf.Reveal.Tour._cl]];
  6. [[Agt.Conf.Reveal.Sample._cl]];
  7. [[Agt.Conf.Reveal.Pouch._cl]];
  8. [[Agt.Conf.Reveal.Login._cl]]; or
  9. [[Agt.Conf.Reveal.Obvious._cl]].
[[Category:Core.Agt]]

For good order, the Receiving Party's {Confidentiality Engagement} applies only to Confidential Information that the Disclosing Party reveals to the Receiving Party by one of the following methods ("Confidential Method") [[Category:Core.Agt]]
documents and other records that are prominently marked as "Confidential," "Proprietary{q}" or the like [[Category:Core.Agt]]
information specifically mentioned in the Prologue as "Critical Confidential Information," is subject to the Confidentiality Engagements regardless of how it is revealed [[Category:Core.Agt]]

information revealed in a form other than a record if the Disclosing Party makes a contemporaneous statement or indication that such information is confidential and confirms the confidentiality of the subject matter by email either before it is revealed or within {Conf.Reveal.Mention.Post.Days} after it is revealed [[Category:Core.Agt]]
in a scheduled meeting among Representatives of the respective parties [[Category:Core.Agt]]
by a visit to the premises of the Disclosing Party or to premises of a non-party enabled by the Disclosing Party [[Category:Core.Agt]]
by sample, prototype{q} or other physical medium [[Category:Core.Agt]]
by a formal disclosure communicated from the Disclosing Party to the Receiving Party via their respective IP Point Persons [[Category:Core.Agt]]
by access to a database or other electronic system owned or controlled by the Disclosing Party [[Category:Core.Agt]]
by any method to the extent it is obvious that the information is confidential [[Category:Core.Agt]]

[[Agt.Conf.Except._Sec|Exceptions]]. "Confidentiality Exceptions" means the exceptions to the Confidentiality Engagement stated here.
  1. [[Agt.Conf.Except.List._Sec]]
  2. [[Agt.Conf.Except.Compelled._Sec]]
  3. [[Agt.Conf.Except.Residual._Sec]]
[[Category:Core.Agt]]

[[Agt.Conf.Except.List._Sec|Listed Exceptions]]. [[Agt.Conf.Except.Intro._Cl]]:
  1. [[Agt.Conf.Except.Makes._cl]];
  2. [[Agt.Conf.Except.Finds._cl]];
  3. [[Agt.Conf.Except.Has._cl]];
  4. [[Agt.Conf.Except.Release._cl]];
  5. [[Agt.Conf.Except.Authorize._cl]]; or
  6. [[Agt.Conf.Except.Public._cl]].
[[Category:Core.Agt]]
The Confidentiality Engagement does not apply to any information that [[Category:Core.Agt]]
is independently developed by the Receiving Party without use of or reference to the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information [[Category:Core.Agt]]
the Receiving Party obtains from a person who has the right to communicate such information [[Category:Core.Agt]]
is known by the Receiving Party prior to time that the Disclosing Party communicates it to the Receiving Party [[Category:Core.Agt]]
{DP.the} discloses to third parties without a legally binding obligation of confidentiality [[Category:Core.Agt]]
{DP.the} expressly authorizes {RP.the} to use or disclose [[Category:Core.Agt]]
is or becomes publicly available (other than as a result of a breach of this Agreement by {RP.the}) [[Category:Core.Agt]]

<u>[[Agt.Conf.Except.Residual._Sec|Residual Knowledge]]</u>. This Agreement is not intended to prevent {RP.the} from using Residual Knowledge, subject to any valid patents, copyrights{q} and semiconductor mask work rights of {DP.the}. [[Category:Core.Agt]]

[[Agt.Conf.Care._Sec|Measures of Protection]]. [[Agt.Conf.Care.Intro._Cl]].
  1. [[Agt.Conf.Care.AsOwn._Sec]]
  2. [[Agt.Conf.Care.Customary._Sec]]
  3. [[Agt.Conf.Care.NeedToKnow._Sec]]
  4. [[Agt.Conf.Care.BindAgent._Sec]]
  5. [[Agt.Conf.Care.ITSecurity._Sec]]
  6. [[Agt.Conf.Care.DerivativeRecord._Sec]].
[[Category:Core.Agt]]
The Receiving Party will protect the Confidential Information against use or disclosure by maintaining at least the following "Protective Measures" [[Category:Core.Agt]]

<u>[[Agt.Conf.Care.AsOwn._Sec|Own Measures]]</u>. The Receiving Party will protect the Confidential Information using all the measures that the Receiving Party uses to protect its own confidential information. [[Category:Core.Agt]]
<u>[[Agt.Conf.Care.Customary._Sec|Reasonable Measures]]</u>. The Receiving Party will use at least such Protective Measures as are customary in its industry. [[Category:Core.Agt]]

<u>[[Agt.Conf.Care.NeedToKnow._Sec|Need to Know]]</u>. The Receiving Party will assure that Confidential Information is circulated only to persons who need to know such information to accomplish the Purpose. [[Category:Core.Agt]]

<u>[[Agt.Conf.Care.BindAgent._Sec|Binding Agreement]]</u>. Before circulating information to any person, the Receiving Party will assure that such person has a binding legal duty to protect the Confidential Information in a manner consistent with this Agreement based on a written agreement or other demonstrable legal duty. [[Category:Core.Agt]]

<u>[[Agt.Conf.Care.ITSecurity._Sec|IT Security]]</u>. The Receiving Party will assure the security of any IT system on which it stores Confidential Information or through which Confidential Information is available. The Receiving Party will assure that such IT system strictly limits access to Confidential Information to persons authorized to receive it under this Agreement and maintains a permanent record of actual accesses. [[Category:Core.Agt]]

<u>[[Agt.Conf.Care.DerivativeRecord._Sec|Derivative Records]]</u>. The Receiving Party will assure that copies, extracts and summaries containing Confidential Information ("Derivative Records") are made only as needed for the Purpose. The Receiving Party will assure that a record is kept of all Derivative Records. [[Category:Core.Agt]]

<u>[[Agt.Term.Agreed.EndFixedDate._Sec|Agreed Term]]</u>.  The Confidentiality Engagement applies to Confidential Information revealed between the dates of {Agt.Term.Begin.YMD} and {Agt.Term.End.YMD}. [[Category:Core.Agt]]

[[Agt.Conf.Engage.Term._Sec| Agt.Conf.Engage.Term._Sec- Select]]:
  1. Agt.Conf.Engage.Term.Indefinite._Sec: [[Agt.Conf.Engage.Term.Indefinite._Sec]]
  2. Agt.Conf.Engage.Term.FixedDate._Sec: [[Agt.Conf.Engage.Term.FixedDate._Sec]]
[[Category:Core.Agt]]

<u>[[NDA.Agt.Term.Stop._Sec|Voluntary Termination]]</u>.  Either party may terminate this Agreement by giving notice to the other party in accordance with the terms of this Agreement. [[Category:Core.Agt]]

[[NDA.Agt.Term.After._Sec|Effect of Termination]]. 
  1. The Confidentiality Engagements do not apply to Confidential Information revealed after termination.
  2. The Confidentiality Engagements continue to apply to Confidential Information revealed prior to termination.
  3. The provisions of this Agreement under the headings "Disclaimers," "Remedies," "Dispute Resolution" and "Miscellaneous" continue to apply after the termination of this Agreement.
[[Category:Core.Agt]]

<u>[[Agt.Disclaim.Agency._Sec|No Agency, Joint Venture{q} or Partnership]]</u>. Nothing in this Agreement and no action taken by the parties hereto pursuant to this Agreement shall create a relationship of principal and agent or constitute a partnership or joint venture of any kind between the parties. Except as may otherwise be expressly provided, a party has no authority to bind another party. [[Category:Core.Agt]]
{{:Agt.Disclaim.Agency._Sec}}

[[NDA.Agt.Disclaim._Sec|Disclaimers]].
  1. [[Agt.Disclaim.Agency._Sec]]
  2. [[Agt.Disclaim.Impart._Sec]]
  3. [[Agt.Disclaim.Exclusive._Sec]]
  4. [[Agt.Disclaim.Deal._Sec]]
  5. [[Agt.Disclaim.RepWar.Info._Sec]]
  6. [[Agt.Disclaim.License._Sec]]
[[Category:Core.Agt]]

<u>[[Agt.Disclaim.Impart._Sec|No Obligation to Disclose]]</u>. The Disclosing Party has no obligation under this Agreement to communicate any information, nor any obligation to update or complete any information that has been communicated. [[Category:Core.Agt]]

<u>[[Agt.Disclaim.Exclusive._Sec|Discussions Are Not-Exclusive]]</u>. The discussions contemplated by this Agreement are not exclusive and each party reserves the right to have similar, competing{q} or conflicting discussions with other parties. [[Category:Core.Agt]]

<u>[[Agt.Disclaim.Deal._Sec|No Business Obligation]]</u>. Nothing herein shall obligate either party to proceed with any transaction between them. Each party reserves the right to terminate the discussions contemplated by this Agreement in its sole discretion and without liability to the other. [[Category:Core.Agt]]

[[Agt.Disclaim.RepWar.Info._Sec|No Warranty]]. All Confidential Information is provided "as is." Neither party makes any warranty or representation, express, implied{q} or otherwise, written or oral with respect to the Confidential Information, and all such representations and warranties are hereby disclaimed, including without limitation: (i) warranties or conditions of merchantability, (ii) satisfactory quality, accuracy, fitness for a particular purpose, completeness or performance{q} or title and non-infringement, and (iii) those arising by statue or from a course of dealing or usage of trade. [[Category:Core.Agt]]

<u>[[Agt.Disclaim.License._Sec|No License]]</u>. This Agreement does not grant any right in or to any intellectual property of another party. In particular, it does not grant any right to Confidential Information or any right under any patent, mask work right, copyright{q} or trade secret. [[Category:Core.Agt]]

<u>[[Agt.Remedy.Cumulative._Sec|Remedies Cumulative]]</u>.  All remedies under this Agreement, under applicable law{q} or otherwise afforded to any party shall be cumulative and not alternative except as may be otherwise expressly stated. [[Category:Core.Agt]]

[[Agt.Remedy.ConfReturn._Sec|Return or Destroy Confidential Information]]. At the request of the Disclosing Party, the Receiving Party will destroy or re-deliver to the Disclosing Party any Confidential Information it has received, without retaining any copy thereof. The Disclosing Party will promptly destroy any record derived from the Confidential Information. At the request of the Disclosing Party, an officer of the Receiving Party will certify that the Receiving Party has complied with this Section. [[Category:Core.Agt]]

[[NDA.Agt.Def;Usage._Sec|Definitions and Usage]].
  1. [[NDA.Agt.Def._Sec]]
  2. [[Agt.Usage._Sec]]
[[Category:Core.Agt]]

[[NDA.Agt.Def._Sec|Definitions]].
  1. [[Agt.Def.Agent]]
  2. [[Agt.Def.Disclosing_Party]]
  3. [[Agt.Def.Critical_Confidential_Information]]
  4. [[Agt.Def.IP_Point_Person]]
  5. [[Agt.Def.Proceeding]]
  6. [[Agt.Def.Receiving_Party]]
  7. [[Agt.Def.Residual_Knowledge]]
[[Category:Core.Agt]]

<u>Governing Law</u>. This Agreement shall be construed in accordance with and governed by the laws of {Dispute.Law.State.the}, without regard to its conflicts of laws provisions and as if all the facts and events relating to the parties and the negotiation, signature{q} and performance of this Agreement took place exclusively in such jurisdiction. [[Category:Core.Agt]]
{{:Agt.Dispute.Law._Sec}}
{Doc.Meta}{Doc.Body} [[Category:Core.Agt]]

<u>[[Agt.Misc.Independent._Sec|Independent Contractors]]</u>. Each {party} is an independent contractor. No party is an employee, joint venture partner{q} or agent of another party. Except as expressly provided in this Agreement, no party has any right to hold itself out as a representative of, to bind or to make commitments on behalf of, another party. No party has a right to claim benefits under any other party's plans applicable to that party's employees. Each party will be responsible for its tax reporting and payment. [[Category:Core.Agt]]

All notices and other communications given or made pursuant to this Agreement will be in writing and will be deemed effectively given upon the earlier of:
  1. actual receipt, acknowledged by the recipient;
  2. {{:Agt.Misc.Notice.Deliv.Personal._cl}};
  3. {{:Agt.Misc.Notice.Deliv.Fax/Email._cl}};
  4. {{:Agt.Misc.Notice.Deliv.Mail._cl}}; or
  5. {{:Agt.Misc.Notice.Deliv.OverNight._cl}}.
[[Category:Core.Agt]]

The address and other contact information set forth in the signature block of this Agreement will be used for any notices. A party may modify the contact information used for it by giving notice to the other parties in accordance with this Section. [[Category:Core.Agt]]
[[Org_ABA/MSPA.V2.Agt.Misc.Time._Sec]] [[Category:Core.Agt]]

revision.comment: Created page with "1 is for single phrases. As "3" is for triples - [[:Category:3]]. [[Category:Core.Agt]]"
revision.text: 1 is for single phrases. As "3" is for triples - [[:Category:3]]. [[Category:Core.Agt]]

<u>[[Model.Employ.Agt.Rep._Sec|Employee Representations]]</u>.
#{RepWar.Epyee._Sec}
[[Category:Core.Agt]]

Disputes.
  1. {Dispute.Law._Sec}
  2. {Dispute.Escalate._Sec}
  3. {Dispute.Proc._Sec}
  4. {Dispute.Forum._Sec}
  5. {Dispute.JuryWaiver._Sec}
[[Category:Core.Agt]]
“<u>Termination Date</u>” means the date on which this Agreement is effectively terminated. [[Category:Core.Agt.Def]]
"<u>Representative</u>" means a person who acts on behalf of a Party. [[Category:Core.Agt.Def]]

"[[Agt.Def.Disclosing_Party|Disclosing Party]]" means a party who reveals Confidential Information to another party under the terms of this Agreement. In the case of mutual or multilateral revelations of Confidential Information, with respect to each element of Confidential Information, the party revealing the Confidential Information is the Disclosing Party and the party receiving the Confidential Information is the Receiving Party. [[Category:Core.Agt.Def]]

"[[Agt.Def.Receiving_Party|{RP}]]" means a party who receives Confidential Information from another party under the terms of this Agreement. In the case of mutual disclosures or other multilateral revealing of Confidential Information, with respect to each element of Confidential Information the party revealing the Confidential Information is {DP.the} and the party receiving the Confidential Information is {RP.the}. [[Category:Core.Agt.Def]]

"[[Agt.Def.Confidential_Information|{Confidential Information}]]" means information that:
  1. relates to {Confidential Subject Matter};
  2. is revealed by the Disclosing Party to the Receiving Party by a {Confidential Method}; and
  3. is not subject to a {Confidentiality Exception}.
{Confidential Information} includes any analyses, compilations, studies{q} or other documents, records{q} or data prepared by the Receiving Party or any of its Agents that contain or are generated from any such information. [[Category:Core.Agt.Def]]

"[[Agt.Def.Critical_Confidential_Information|Critical Confidential Information]]" means the information which may be specifically designated in the Prologue to this Agreement as such. Critical Confidential Information is subject to the Confidentiality Engagements without respect to the Confidentiality Exceptions or the method by which it was revealed. [[Category:Core.Agt.Def]]

"[[Agt.Def.IP_Point_Person|IP Point Person]]" means an individual appointed by a party to act as the formal gateway for Confidential Information. The IP Point Person will always be a single individual. A party may designate an IP Point Person by notice to the other parties and may change the IP Point Person by prior notice to the other parties. If a party has designated an IP Point Person, then all revelations of Confidential Information must be made to that person or with that person's express written approval. [[Category:Core.Agt.Def]]

"[[Agt.Def.Proceeding|Proceeding]]" means any action, arbitration, mediation, audit, hearing, investigation, litigation{q} or suit (whether civil, criminal, administrative, judicial{q} or investigative) commenced, brought, conducted{q} or heard by or before{q} or otherwise involving, any governmental body or arbitrator. [[Category:Core.Agt.Def]]

"[[Agt.Def.Residual_Knowledge|Residual Knowledge]]" means ideas, concepts, know-how{q} or techniques related to the Disclosing Party's technology that are retained in the unaided memories of the Receiving Party's employees who have had access to Confidential Information. An employee's memory will be considered to be unaided if the employee has not intentionally memorized the Confidential Information for the purpose of retaining and subsequently using or disclosing it. [[Category:Core.Agt.Def]]

[[Agt.Usage._Sec|Usage]].
  1. In this Agreement, unless expressly stated otherwise:
    1. the singular includes the plural and vice versa;
    2. reference to any Person includes such Person's successors and assigns, if applicable, but only if such successors and assigns are permitted by this Agreement, and reference to a Person in a particular capacity excludes such Person in any other capacity;
    3. reference to a gender includes the other gender;
    4. reference to any agreement, document, or instrument means such agreement, document, or instrument as amended or modified and in effect from time to time in accordance with its terms;
    5. reference to any Legal Requirement means that Legal Requirement as from time to time in effect, including any amendment, modification, codification, replacement, or reenactment of such Legal Requirement;
    6. reference to any section or other provision of any Legal Requirement means that provision of such Legal Requirement as from time to time in effect, including any amendment, modification, codification, replacement, or reenactment of such section or other provision;
    7. "hereunder," "hereof," "hereto," and words of similar import refer to this Agreement as a whole and not to any particular Article, Section, or other provision of this Agreement;
    8. "including" (and with correlative meaning "include") means including without limiting the generality of any description preceding such term; "or" is used in the inclusive sense of "and/or";
    9. "any" means "any and all";
    10. with respect to the determination of any period of time, "from" means "from and including" and "to" means "to but excluding";
    11. reference to any agreement, document, or instrument means such agreement, document, or instrument as amended or modified and in effect from time to time in accordance with its terms; and
    12. a reference to a "copy" or "copies" of any document, instrument, or agreement means a copy or copies that are complete and correct.
  2. This Agreement was negotiated by the parties with the benefit of legal representation, and any rule of construction or interpretation otherwise requiring this Agreement to be construed or interpreted against any party as having been drafted by it will not apply to any construction or interpretation of this Agreement.
  3. The headings contained in this Agreement are for convenience of reference only, shall not be deemed to be part of this Agreement, and shall not be referred to in connection with the construction or interpretation of this Agreement.
[[Category:Core.Agt.Def]]

<u>Delays or Omissions</u>. No delay or omission to exercise any right, power or remedy accruing to any party under this Agreement, upon any breach or default of any other party under this Agreement, shall impair any such right, power{q} or remedy of such non-breaching or non-defaulting party nor shall it be construed to be a waiver of any such breach or default, or an acquiescence therein, or of or in any similar breach or default thereafter occurring; nor shall any waiver of any single breach or default be deemed a waiver of any other breach or default theretofore or thereafter occurring. Any waiver, permit, consent or approval of any kind or character on the part of any party of any breach or default under this Agreement, or any waiver on the part of any party of any provisions or conditions of this Agreement, must be in writing and shall be effective only to the extent specifically set forth in such writing.

  1. {Moz.Dispute.Base._Sec}
  2. {Moz.Dispute.Cost._Sec}

Moz.Dispute.Law._Sec=Governing Law. This Agreement will be interpreted and construed in accordance with the laws of {Moz.Dispute.Law.State.the}, without regard to conflict of law principles. Moz.Dispute.Base._Sec=Disputes. Except as provided in Section {Remedy.Injunct._Sec.Xnum}, any dispute or controversy arising out of, relating to or in connection with the interpretation, validity, construction, performance, breach{q} or termination of this Agreement will be settled by binding arbitration to be held in {Dispute.Seat._cl}, in accordance with the {Dispute.Arb.Rules} of {Dispute.Arb.Institute} as then in effect. The arbitrator may grant injunctions or other relief in such dispute or controversy. The decision of the arbitrator will be final, conclusive{q} and binding on the parties to the arbitration. Judgment may be entered on the arbitrator’s decision in any court of competent jurisdiction. Moz.Dispute.Cost._Sec={Moz.Dispute.Cost._Sec.Select} Moz.Dispute.Cost._Sec.Select=
Moz.Dispute.Cost._SecText
Moz.Dispute.Cost.Base._Sec{Moz.Dispute.Cost.Base._Sec}
Moz.Dispute.Cost.Shift.Prevailing._Sec{Moz.Dispute.Cost.Shift.Prevailing._Sec}
Moz.Dispute.Cost.Base._Sec=Costs. Each party shall each pay one-half of the costs and expenses of such arbitration, and each shall separately pay its counsel fees and expenses unless otherwise required by law. In any court action at law or equity which is brought by one of the parties to enforce or interpret the provisions of this Agreement, each party shall pay its own attorney’s fees. Moz.Dispute.Cost.Shift.Prevailing._Sec={Moz.Dispute.Cost.Base._Sec} In the award, in addition to any other relief, the arbitrator shall award to the prevailing party all of the prevailing party's reasonable costs for the foregoing. Moz.Dispute.Acknowledgement._Sec=Acknowledgment. Each party has read and understands this Section {Dispute._Sec.Xnum}. Each party acknowledges that by signing this agreement, it will be obligated to submit any claims arising out of, relating to, or in connection with this agreement, or the interpretation, validity, construction, performance, breach{q} or termination thereof, to binding arbitration, except as provided in Section {Remedy.Injunct._Sec.Xnum}. This arbitration clause constitutes a waiver of each party’s right to a jury trial and governs the resolution of all disputes relating to all aspects of the relationship between the parties. Moz.Remedy.Injunct._Sec=Equitable Relief. The parties may apply to any court of competent jurisdiction for a temporary restraining order, preliminary injunction{q} or other interim or conservatory relief. Remedy.Injunct._Sec.Xnum={Dispute._Sec.Xnum}.3 [[Category:Agt.Dispute]]

Comp.Acceptance.TimeLapse._Sec={Acceptance.TimeLapse.Period} after {Pcpl.-}’s receipt of the Work Product without {Pcpl.-} rejecting the Work Product.

Any written notice of rejection shall set forth in reasonable detail the basis for {Pcpl.-}’s rejection. Upon receipt of a written notice of rejection, {Cttr.-} shall make commercially reasonable efforts to submit a revised deliverable within five business days or as mutually agreed in writing between the parties, and the deliverable shall again be subject to the acceptance procedure described above. Comp.Expense.AirAndLodging._Sen=Air travel shall be at coach fares and lodging shall be at moderately priced hotels, taking advantage of available corporate discounts. Comp.Expense.Base.Reimburse._Sen={Pcpl.-} will reimburse {Cttr.-} for reasonable and necessary expenses incurred in the performance of the Services for which {Cttr.-} provides documentation; provided, however, that all such expenses shall be subject to {Pcpl.-}'s prior written approval (email will suffice). Comp.Expense._Sec=Expenses. {Comp.Expense.Base.Reimburse._Sen} {Comp.Expense.AirAndLodging._Sen} Comp.Fee._Sec=Fees. {Pcpl.-} will pay {Cttr.-} the compensation set forth in the applicable SOW for the performance of the Services described in that SOW. Such fees may be on a time and materials basis, or on a milestone basis, or otherwise as agreed by the parties and specified in the SOW. Comp.Pay._Sec=Payments. {Cttr.-} must submit invoices in order to receive payment. Provided {Pcpl.-} has accepted the Work Product and unless specified otherwise in the applicable SOW, invoices may be submitted monthly if payment is on a time and materials basis or in accordance with the payment schedule in the applicable SOW if on a milestone basis, and payment will be due 30 days following receipt of {Cttr.-}’s invoice. Invoices should include all approved expenses and taxes and any other approved fees for the accepted work. Upon termination of this Agreement or any SOW for any reason, {Cttr.-} will be paid fees on a proportional basis as stated in the SOW in effect at the time of termination for work which has been completed, to and including the effective date of such termination. If fees have been paid in advance and this Agreement or the applicable SOW is terminated by {Pcpl.-} for cause, {Cttr.-} shall refund any amounts not yet earned as determined by multiplying {Cttr.-}’s hourly rate (standard or negotiated by the parties as applicable) by the amount of time put into the project. Comp._Art.Xref=Section 2 (Compensation) Conf.Borrowing._Sec=No Disclosure to {Pcpl.-}. {Cttr.-} agrees that in the course of providing the Services, it will not improperly use, disclose, or bring onto {Pcpl.-}’s premises any proprietary information or trade secrets of its other customers or any other third party. Conf.Def._Sec=Definition. “Confidential Information” means: {Conf.Include.Listing} Conf.Engage._Sec=Obligations. {Cttr.-} agrees: (i) to hold and maintain in strict confidence the Confidential Information and not to disclose it to any third party other than its employees and subcontractors who have a need to know and have executed confidentiality agreements with {Cttr.-} no less protective of the Confidential Information than this Section; (ii) to protect the Confidential Information from disclosure with the same degree of care it uses to protect its own proprietary information similar in nature, but in no event less than a reasonable degree of care; (iii) not to use any Confidential Information except as permitted by this Agreement; (iv) to return or destroy Confidential Information promptly upon {Pcpl.-}’s written request; and (v) to keep all Deliverables and Work Product (defined below) created for {Pcpl.-} confidential unless and until they are made public by {Pcpl.-}. Conf.Except._Sec=Exclusions. Confidential Information does not include information that {Cttr.-} can document (i) has entered the public domain through a source other than {Cttr.-} and through no fault of {Cttr.-}, including via {Pcpl.-}’s public tools (including but not limited to public forums, public blogs, and the public portions of bugzilla.com); (ii) was rightfully known to {Cttr.-} without a confidentiality obligation prior to the commencement of the Services; (iii) is disclosed to {Cttr.-} by a third party that has no confidentiality obligation; or (iv) is developed by {Cttr.-} independently of and without reference to any Confidential Information. In addition, {Cttr.-} may disclose Confidential Information in response to a valid order by a court or other governmental body, or as otherwise required by law. Conf.Include.Legended=any other information that has been reduced to writing and marked “Confidential” Conf.Include.Listing=(i) {Conf.Include.Personal}; (ii) {Conf.Include.3Party}; (iii) {Conf.Include.NotReleased}; (iv) {Conf.Include.ThisAgreement}; (v) {Conf.Include.ThisPrice}; and (vi) {Conf.Include.Legended}. Conf.Include.NotReleased=all business and financial information that has not been released to the public such as business plans, financial results, and product roadmaps Conf.Include.Personal=all personally identifiable information, including without limitation, of {Pcpl.-}’s customers and employees Conf.Include.3Party=all information and materials received by {Pcpl.-} from a third party under an obligation of confidentiality Conf.Include.ThisAgreement=the existence and the terms of this Agreement (including SOWs) Conf.Include.ThisPrice=the pricing agreed upon by the parties Conf._Art.Xref=Section 3 (Confidentiality) Dispute._Art.Xref=Section 11 Engage.Scope.SOW-BecomesPartOfThisAgreement=Each Statement of Work, upon execution by both parties, will be incorporated into this Agreement and will be sequentially numbered as Exhibit A-1, A-2, and so on. Engage.Scope.SOW-Define._Sen=The work to be performed by {Cttr.-} hereunder (the “Services”) will be described in Statements of Work (“SOW”s). Engage.Scope.SOW-LegallySubordinate._Sen=In the event of any conflict between the terms of this Agreement and any SOW, the terms of the SOW will govern. Engage.Scope.SOW-OneForEachProject._Sen=A SOW will be prepared for each project to be performed by {Cttr.-} under this Consulting Agreement (“Agreement”). Engage.Scope._Sec=Scope. {Engage.Scope.SOW-Define._Sen} {Engage.Scope.SOW-OneForEachProject._Sen} {Engage.Scope.SOW-BecomesPartOfThisAgreement} {Engage.Scope.SOW-LegallySubordinate._Sen} Engage.Subcontractors._Sec=Subcontractors. {Pcpl.-} acknowledges that {Cttr.-} may, with prior written permission from {Pcpl.-}, engage subcontractors in the performance of some of the Services. {Cttr.-} acknowledges that (i) the use of subcontractors shall not release it from its obligations under this Agreement, (ii) it shall be responsible for all work and activities of its subcontractors, including compliance with the terms of this Agreement, and (iii) it shall be responsible for all payments and legal obligations to its subcontractors. Forum.County=Santa Clara County, California Indemn.Cttr.Notice._Sec=Notification. {Pcpl.-} shall promptly notify {Cttr.-} of the assertion of any claim covered by this Section. Failure to so notify shall not relieve {Cttr.-} of its obligations hereunder except to the extent such failure actually and materially caused prejudice. {Pcpl.-} may, at its expense and option, cooperate in the defense of or response to such claim. Remedy.Cttr.InfringingSoftware._Sec=Procedures. If any Work Product is, or in {Pcpl.-}’s reasonable judgment may become, the subject of a claim of infringement brought by third parties, {Cttr.-} may at its option and expense: (i) replace the allegedly infringing Work Product with other suitable and functionally equivalent materials; (ii) modify the Work Product to make it non-infringing provided that it is functionally equivalent; (iii) procure a license for {Pcpl.-} to continue to use and maintain the Work Product; or (iv) if and only if all of the above are impracticable, require the return by {Pcpl.-} to {Cttr.-} of the allegedly infringing Work Product and declare the termination of all rights of {Pcpl.-} with respect thereto, provided in such case that {Cttr.-} shall return to {Pcpl.-} all payments made to {Cttr.-} with respect to such returned Work Product. Any termination of rights shall be prospective only and shall not cause revocation of rights that have already been exercised by {Pcpl.-}. Indemn.Cttr.Scope._Sec=Scope. {Cttr.-} shall indemnify and hold harmless {Pcpl.-}, its agents, officers, directors, employees, contractors, subsidiaries, and parent from any losses, liabilities, damages, claims, payments, liens, judgments, demands, costs and expenses (including reasonable attorney’s fees) arising out of {Cttr.-}’s breach of this Agreement or negligence in the performance of the Services. IP.Owner.CoPublishedAsOpenSource._Sec=Distribution Under Open Source Licenses. If the Work Product includes the development of source code that {Pcpl.-} publishes under an open source license, without affecting the ownership rights between the parties hereto, the code may contain a notice attributing authorship to {Cttr.-}. {Cttr.-} hereby agrees to comply with {Pcpl.-}’s practices regarding the use and disclosure of Intellectual Property owned by {Pcpl.-} and third parties. IP.Owner.PreExisting.Cttr._Sec=Pre-Existing {Cttr.-} Materials. Notwithstanding any other provision of this agreement, {Cttr.-} shall retain all right, title and interest in and to, including any Intellectual Property rights with respect to (i) any source code, object code, know-how, materials and information created by {Cttr.-} or it licensors prior to the Effective Date or independently of the Services (and any derivative works, modifications and enhancements thereto) and (ii) any source code, object code or know-how created by {Cttr.-} in connection with the Services (or partially in connection with the Services) which is generally applicable, non-site specific, and represents functionality already readily available to the public (collectively, "{Cttr.-} Materials"). If in the course of performing the Services, {Cttr.-} incorporates into any Work Product any {Cttr.-} Materials, (i) {Cttr.-} shall inform {Pcpl.-} in writing before incorporating such {Cttr.-} Materials into any Work Product; and (ii) subject to fulfillment of {Pcpl.-}’s payment obligations, {Cttr.-} hereby grants {Pcpl.-}, under all of {Cttr.-}’s rights therein, a nonexclusive, royalty-free, perpetual, irrevocable, worldwide license to use, reproduce, distribute, perform, display, modify, sublicense, and transfer such {Cttr.-} Materials. IP.Owner.PreExisting.Pcpl._Sec=Pre-Existing {Pcpl.-} Materials. {Cttr.-} agrees that all {Pcpl.-} Confidential Information and any intellectual property related thereto as well as all intellectual property rights in materials supplied to {Cttr.-} by {Pcpl.-} to perform the Services shall be the sole property of {Pcpl.-} or its licensors, and {Cttr.-} obtains no rights to such Confidential Information or materials. IP.Owner.3Party._Sec=Third Party Materials; Open Source. {Cttr.-} shall not incorporate any proprietary information or materials owned by any third party (“Third Party Materials”) into any Work Product without {Pcpl.-}’s prior written permission and only if {Cttr.-} has all necessary rights to do so. Prior to incorporating into any Work Product any third party software or any source code licensed under an open source license, {Cttr.-} will notify {Pcpl.-} and will obtain {Pcpl.-}’s written consent. If any such Third Party Materials are incorporated into any Work Product (after consent by {Pcpl.-}), {Pcpl.-}’s use of such materials shall be subject to the license obligations related to such materials. IP.Owner.WorkProduct.IsMadeForHire._Sec=Ownership of Work Product. All work product created by {Cttr.-} in the course of performing the Services, including all Deliverables (as defined in SOWs), and including all Intellectual Property rights therein (“Work Product”) shall be deemed “works made for hire” under this Agreement, and, except for Third Party Materials or Pre-Existing Materials (defined below), {Pcpl.-} shall have exclusive ownership and be deemed the author thereof in accordance with the copyright laws of the United States. Remedy.Liab.Limit._Sec=Limitation of Liability. Except for breaches of the confidentiality provisions of this agreement, {Cttr.-}’s representations and warranties, and {Cttr.-}’s indemnification obligations, neither party shall be liable to the other for any lost profits or for any special, incidental, indirect, exemplary, punitive, or consequential damages arising out of or in connection with this agreement (whether from breach of contract, negligence, strict liability or other cause of action), even if such party has been advised of the possibility of such damages. Except for breaches of the confidentiality provisions of this agreement, {Cttr.-}’s representations and warranties, and {Cttr.-}’s indemnification obligations, neither party’s liability arising out of this agreement will exceed the amounts paid by {Pcpl.-} to {Cttr.-} hereunder. The parties waive any right to receive any compensation or reparations upon expiration or earlier termination of this agreement under the law of any country or otherwise, other than as expressly provided in this agreement. The parties acknowledge that this section has been included as a material inducement for the parties to enter into this agreement and that each party would not have entered into this agreement but for the limitations of liability as set forth herein. Misc.Assign._Sec={Misc.Assign.ContractorServiceIsUnique._Sec} Misc.Assign.ContractorServiceIsUnique._Sec=Nonassignment/Binding Agreement. The parties acknowledge that the unique nature of {Cttr.-}’s services is substantial consideration for the parties’ entering into this Agreement. Neither this Agreement nor any rights under this Agreement may be assigned or otherwise transferred by {Cttr.-}, in whole or in part, whether voluntarily or by operation of law, without the prior written consent of {Pcpl.-}, which consent will not be unreasonably withheld. Subject to the foregoing, this Agreement will be binding upon and will inure to the benefit of the parties and their respective successors and assigns. Any assignment in violation of the foregoing will be null and void. Misc.Counterpart._Sec=Counterparts. This Agreement may be executed in counterparts, each of which so executed will be deemed to be an original and such counterparts together will constitute one and the same agreement. The parties will be entitled to rely upon a signed copy of this Agreement transmitted via facsimile or email as if it were an original signed counterpart. Misc.Entire._Sec=Integration. This Agreement (and the Statements of Work) contains the entire agreement of the parties with respect to the subject matter of this Agreement and supersedes all previous communications, representations, understandings and agreements, either oral or written, between the parties with respect to said subject matter. No terms, provisions or conditions of any purchase order, acknowledgement or other business form that either party may use in connection with the transactions contemplated by this Agreement will have any effect on the rights, duties or obligations of the parties under, or otherwise modify, this Agreement, regardless of any failure of a receiving party to object to such terms, provisions or conditions. This Agreement may not be amended, except by a writing signed by both parties. Misc.Independent._Sec=Independent Contractors. It is the intention of the parties that {Cttr.-} is an independent contractor. Nothing in this Agreement will in any way be construed to constitute {Cttr.-} as an agent, employee or representative of {Pcpl.-}, but {Cttr.-} shall perform the Services hereunder as an independent contractor. {Cttr.-} shall furnish (or reimburse {Pcpl.-} for) all tools and materials necessary to accomplish this contract, and will incur all expenses associated with performance, except as expressly provided on the applicable Statement of Work. {Cttr.-} acknowledges and agrees that {Cttr.-} is obligated to report as income all compensation received by {Cttr.-} pursuant to this Agreement, and {Cttr.-} acknowledges its obligation to pay all applicable taxes on such compensation. Misc.Notice._Sec=Notices. Any notice required or permitted by this agreement or by law must be delivered in writing to the addresses of the parties identified in this agreement (or other address provided by a party) and may be delivered by any of the following methods: (a) personal delivery, (b) certified or registered postal mail, return receipt requested, or (c) express courier service, fully prepaid. Notices may also be delivered by facsimile if followed up by delivery via (a), (b), or (c). Notices to {Pcpl.-} should be delivered via email to {Pcpl.Contact.ID.Email} in addition to delivery by any other method. Notices will be deemed to have been delivered the same day if delivered in person, in 5 days if delivered by postal mail, and in 3 days if delivered by express courier. Misc.Sever._Sec=Severability. If any term, condition, or provision in this Agreement is found to be invalid, unlawful or unenforceable to any extent, the parties shall endeavor in good faith to agree to such amendments that will preserve, as far as possible, the intentions expressed in this Agreement. If the parties fail to agree on such an amendment, such invalid term, condition or provision will be severed from the remaining terms, conditions and provisions, which will continue to be valid and enforceable to the fullest extent permitted by law. Misc.Waive._Sec=Waiver. Any waiver of the provisions of this Agreement or of a party’s rights or remedies under this Agreement must be in writing to be effective. Failure, neglect, or delay by a party to enforce the provisions of this Agreement or its rights or remedies at any time, will not be construed as a waiver of such party’s rights under this Agreement and will not in any way affect the validity of the whole or any part of this Agreement or prejudice such party’s right to take subsequent action. No exercise or enforcement by either party of any right or remedy under this Agreement will preclude the enforcement by such party of any other right or remedy under this Agreement or that such party is entitled by law to enforce. RepWar.Cttr.ComplyWithLaw._cl=in performing the Services, it will comply with all applicable laws and regulations RepWar.Cttr.ConflictOfInterest._Sec=Conflicting Obligations. {Cttr.-} hereby represents and warrants that {Cttr.-} has no outstanding agreement or obligation that is in conflict with any of the provisions of this Agreement, or that would preclude {Cttr.-} from complying with the provisions hereof. {Cttr.-} will not enter into any such conflicting agreement during the term of this Agreement. RepWar.Cttr.ExceptOpenSource._Sec=Exception for Open Source. For purposes of clarification, these warranties do not include any third party open source code that is incorporated into the Work Product with {Pcpl.-}’s written consent. RepWar.Cttr.Infringe.IP.Patent._cl=the Work Product and the use thereof will not, to the knowledge of {Cttr.-}, infringe any patent right of any third party RepWar.Cttr.Infringe.IP.Soft._cl=the Work Product and the use thereof will not infringe the copyright, trade secret, or any other Intellectual Property (excluding patent) rights of any third party RepWar.Cttr.Lewd._cl=the Work Product will not be obscene, libelous, or violate the right of privacy or publicity of any third party RepWar.Cttr.TitleToLicense._cl=it has sufficient right, title, and interest (as owner, licensee, or otherwise) to grant on an unencumbered basis the rights in the Work Product granted to {Pcpl.-} under this Agreement RepWar.Cttr.Virus._cl=the Work Product will not contain any virus, trap door, worm, malware, spyware, or any other device that is injurious or damaging to software or hardware used in conjunction with the Work Product RepWar.Cttr.Workmanlike._cl=it will at all times perform in a professional and workmanlike manner Survive.List._Xref=Sections 4 (Ownership), 7 (Indemnification), 8 (Limitation of Liability), 9.4 (Survival), 10 (Miscellaneous), and 11 (Arbitration and Equitable Relief) Term.ination._Sec=Termination. Either party may terminate this Agreement or any SOW without cause upon giving 30 days prior written notice thereof to the other party, or any shorter time permitted in an SOW. If either party terminates this Agreement under the prior sentence, {Pcpl.-} shall pay to {Cttr.-} the fees for any Services performed up to and including the effective date of termination. If the fees for the applicable SOW are to be paid on a milestone basis, such fees will not exceed the amount associated with the next uncompleted milestone. Either party may terminate this Agreement immediately upon notice if the other party refuses to or is unable to perform under this Agreement or is in breach of any material provision of this Agreement. Additionally, {Pcpl.-} may terminate this Agreement (a) upon written notice in the event of the completion or termination of a SOW, or (b) upon five days’ written notice in the event the SOW is for the provision of services but does not contain any specified timelines or milestones and {Pcpl.-} deems the services untimely, unprofessional, or unsatisfactory. Term.Renew._Sec=SOW Renewal. An SOW may be renewed upon mutual written agreement of the parties. Term.Survive._Sec=Survival. Upon such termination, all rights and duties of the parties toward each other will cease except: (a) {Pcpl.-} shall pay, within 30 days after the effective date of termination, all amounts owing to {Cttr.-} for Services completed and accepted by {Pcpl.-} prior to the termination date and related expenses, if any, in accordance with the provisions of {Comp._Art.Xref}; and (b) {Conf._Art.Xref} shall survive the termination of this Agreement until all Confidential Information is no longer subject to protection under the terms of {Conf._Art.Xref}; and (c) {Survive.List._Xref} will survive termination of this Agreement. Term.Until._Sec=Term. This Agreement will commence on the Effective Date and will continue until the earlier of: (i) final completion of the Services or (ii) termination as provided below. WorkProduct.Assign._Sec=Assignment and Waiver of Rights. In the event that any Work Product, or any portion thereof, is for any reason deemed not to have been a work made-for-hire, {Cttr.-} hereby assigns to {Pcpl.-} all right, title, and interest in and to such Work Product, subject to {Pcpl.-}’s payment obligations hereunder. {Cttr.-} agrees to assist {Pcpl.-} in securing intellectual property rights in Work Product, at {Pcpl.-}’s expense, during and after the term of this Agreement. If {Cttr.-} is not willing or able to do so, {Cttr.-} hereby appoints {Pcpl.-} as its attorney-in-fact entitled to secure such rights on {Cttr.-}’s behalf. If {Cttr.-} has any rights to the Work Product that cannot be assigned to {Pcpl.-}, {Cttr.-} unconditionally and irrevocably (i) waives the enforcement of such rights, and all claims and causes of action of any kind against {Pcpl.-}, its subsidiaries, and its licensees (through multiple tiers) with respect to such rights, and agrees, at {Pcpl.-}’s request and expense, to consent to and join in any action to enforce such rights, and (ii) grants to {Pcpl.-} during the term of such rights, an exclusive (even as to {Cttr.-}), irrevocable, perpetual, worldwide, fully paid and royalty-free license, with rights to sublicense through multiple levels of sublicensees, under and to all of such rights to Work Product. Comp.Acceptance._Sec=Acceptance. The Services shall be deemed accepted by {Pcpl.-} upon the earlier of:

  1. {Pcpl.-}’s delivery of written acceptance notice;
  2. {Pcpl.-}’s commercial use of the Work Product; or
  3. {Comp.Acceptance.TimeLapse._Sec}
